class.name: Word.View
class.description: Contains the view attributes (such as show all, field shading, and table gridlines) for a window or pane.

properties.name: areAllNonprintingCharactersDisplayed
properties.description: Specifies whether all nonprinting characters are displayed.

properties.name: areBackgroundsDisplayed
properties.description: Gets whether background colors and images are shown when the document is displayed in print layout view.

properties.name: areBookmarksIndicated
properties.description: Gets whether square brackets are displayed at the beginning and end of each bookmark.

properties.name: areCommentsDisplayed
properties.description: Specifies whether Microsoft Word displays the comments in the document.

properties.name: areConnectingLinesToRevisionsBalloonDisplayed
properties.description: Specifies whether Microsoft Word displays connecting lines from the text to the revision and comment balloons.

properties.name: areCropMarksDisplayed
properties.description: Gets whether crop marks are shown in the corners of pages to indicate where margins are located.

properties.name: areDrawingsDisplayed
properties.description: Gets whether objects created with the drawing tools are displayed in print layout view.

properties.name: areEditableRangesShaded
properties.description: Specifies whether shading is applied to the ranges in the document that users have permission to modify.

properties.name: areFieldCodesDisplayed
properties.description: Specifies whether field codes are displayed.

properties.name: areFormatChangesDisplayed
properties.description: Specifies whether Microsoft Word displays formatting changes made to the document with Track Changes enabled.

properties.name: areInkAnnotationsDisplayed
properties.description: Specifies whether handwritten ink annotations are shown or hidden.

properties.name: areInsertionsAndDeletionsDisplayed
properties.description: Specifies whether Microsoft Word displays insertions and deletions made to the document with Track Changes enabled.

properties.name: areLinesWrappedToWindow
properties.description: Gets whether lines wrap at the right edge of the document window rather than at the right margin or the right column boundary.

properties.name: areObjectAnchorsDisplayed
properties.description: Gets whether object anchors are displayed next to items that can be positioned in print layout view.

properties.name: areOptionalBreaksDisplayed
properties.description: Gets whether Microsoft Word displays optional line breaks.

properties.name: areOptionalHyphensDisplayed
properties.description: Gets whether optional hyphens are displayed.

properties.name: areOtherAuthorsVisible
properties.description: Gets whether other authors' presence should be visible in the document.

properties.name: arePageBoundariesDisplayed
properties.description: Gets whether the top and bottom margins and the gray area between pages in the document are displayed.

properties.name: areParagraphsMarksDisplayed
properties.description: Gets whether paragraph marks are displayed.

properties.name: arePicturePlaceholdersDisplayed
properties.description: Gets whether blank boxes are displayed as placeholders for pictures.

properties.name: areRevisionsAndCommentsDisplayed
properties.description: Specifies whether Microsoft Word displays revisions and comments made to the document with Track Changes enabled.

properties.name: areSpacesIndicated
properties.description: Gets whether space characters are displayed.

properties.name: areTableGridlinesDisplayed
properties.description: Specifies whether table gridlines are displayed.

properties.name: areTabsDisplayed
properties.description: Gets whether tab characters are displayed.

properties.name: areTextBoundariesDisplayed
properties.description: Gets whether dotted lines are displayed around page margins, text columns, objects, and frames in print layout view.

properties.name: columnWidth
properties.description: Specifies the column width in Reading mode.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

properties.name: fieldShading
properties.description: Gets on-screen shading for fields.

properties.name: isDraft
properties.description: Specifies whether all the text in a window is displayed in the same sans-serif font with minimal formatting to speed up display.

properties.name: isFirstLineOnlyDisplayed
properties.description: Specifies whether only the first line of body text is shown in outline view.

properties.name: isFormatDisplayed
properties.description: Specifies whether character formatting is visible in outline view.

properties.name: isFullScreen
properties.description: Specifies whether the window is in full-screen view.

properties.name: isHiddenTextDisplayed
properties.description: Gets whether text formatted as hidden text is displayed.

properties.name: isHighlightingDisplayed
properties.description: Gets whether highlight formatting is displayed and printed with the document.

properties.name: isInConflictMode
properties.description: Specifies whether the document is in conflict mode view.

properties.name: isInPanning
properties.description: Specifies whether Microsoft Word is in Panning mode.

properties.name: isInReadingLayout
properties.description: Specifies whether the document is being viewed in reading layout view.

properties.name: isMailMergeDataView
properties.description: Specifies whether mail merge data is displayed instead of mail merge fields.

properties.name: isMainTextLayerVisible
properties.description: Specifies whether the text in the document is visible when the header and footer areas are displayed.

properties.name: isPointerShownAsMagnifier
properties.description: Specifies whether the pointer is displayed as a magnifying glass in print preview.

properties.name: isReadingLayoutActualView
properties.description: Specifies whether pages displayed in reading layout view are displayed using the same layout as printed pages.

properties.name: isXmlMarkupVisible
properties.description: Specifies whether XML tags are visible in the document.

properties.name: markupMode
properties.description: Specifies the display mode for tracked changes.

properties.name: pageColor
properties.description: Specifies the page color in Reading mode.

properties.name: pageMovementType
properties.description: Specifies the page movement type.

properties.name: readingLayoutTruncateMargins
properties.description: Specifies whether margins are visible or hidden when the document is viewed in Full Screen Reading view.

properties.name: revisionsBalloonSide
properties.description: Gets whether Word displays revision balloons in the left or right margin in the document.

properties.name: revisionsBalloonWidth
properties.description: Specifies the width of the revision balloons.

properties.name: revisionsBalloonWidthType
properties.description: Specifies how Microsoft Word measures the width of revision balloons.

properties.name: revisionsFilter
properties.description: Gets the instance of a RevisionsFilter object.

properties.name: seekView
properties.description: Specifies the document element displayed in print layout view.

properties.name: splitSpecial
properties.description: Specifies the active window pane.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Specifies the view type.

methods.name: collapseAllHeadings
methods.description: Collapses all the headings in the document.

methods.name: collapseOutline
methods.description: Collapses the text under the selection or the specified range by one heading level.

params.name: range
params.description: A Range object that specifies the range to collapse.

methods.name: expandAllHeadings
methods.description: Expands all the headings in the document.

methods.name: expandOutline
methods.description: Expands the text under the selection by one heading level.

params.name: range
params.description: A Range object that specifies the range to expand.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

methods.name: nextHeaderFooter
methods.description: Moves to the next header or footer, depending on whether a header or footer is displayed in the view.

methods.name: previousHeaderFooter
methods.description: Moves to the previous header or footer, depending on whether a header or footer is displayed in the view.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

methods.name: showAllHeadings
methods.description: Switches between showing all text (headings and body text) and showing only headings.

methods.name: showHeading
methods.description: Shows all headings up to the specified heading level and hides subordinate headings and body text.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.View object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.ViewData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.
